investment_objective: The Fund seeks daily investment results, before fees and expenses, of 200% of the daily performance of AAPL.
principal_strategies: Under normal circumstances, the Fund invests at least 80% of its net assets in Apple Inc. common shares and financial instruments such as swap agreements and options to seek 2X the daily performance of AAPL, and rebalances daily to maintain its exposure.

fund_name: iShares Inflation Hedged U.S. Aggregate Bond ETF
investment_objective: The Fund seeks to track the investment results of an index designed to mitigate the inflation risk of a portfolio composed of U.S. dollar-denominated, investment-grade bonds.
principal_strategies: The Fund seeks to track the investment results of the BlackRock Inflation Hedged U.S. Aggregate Bond Index (the "Underlying Index"), which is designed to minimize the inflation risk of a portfolio composed of U.S. dollar-denominated, investment-grade bonds. The Fund invests under normal circumstances at least 80% of its net assets in component securities and instruments of its Underlying Index and uses inflation hedging instruments, primarily inflation swaps, to transfer inflation risk while holding fixed-income positions. The Underlying Index is rebalanced daily and may include a series of up to ten inflation swap contracts with different maturities as determined by the index provider.

investment_objective: The Fund seeks daily investment results, before fees and expenses, of -2 times (-200%) the daily percentage change of the common stock of Coinbase Global, Inc. Class A (NASDAQ: COIN).
principal_strategies: The Fund is an actively managed exchange traded fund that attempts to replicate 2x the inverse (-200%) daily percentage change of the Underlying Stock by entering into financial instruments such as swaps and options on the Underlying Stock. At the end of each trading day, the notional exposure against the Underlying Stock obtained through the combination of these instruments will be approximately -200% of the Fund’s net asset value. The Fund aims to generate the inverse daily performance of the Underlying Stock for a single day.

investment_objective: The iShares Gold Strategy ETF seeks to provide exposure, on a total return basis, to the price performance of gold.
principal_strategies: The Fund seeks to achieve its investment objective by investing primarily in a combination of (i) exchange-traded gold futures contracts and other exchange-traded or over-the-counter derivatives (i.e., forward contracts, futures, options and swaps) that correlate to the investment returns of physical gold, based on the notional value of such derivative instruments; and (ii) exchange-traded products (“ETPs”) backed by or linked to physical gold, which may include the iShares Gold Trust (the “Gold Trust”) (together, the “Gold Investments”). The Fund may invest up to 20% of the Fund’s assets in OTC derivatives. In seeking total return, the Fund additionally aims to generate exposure to the Gold Investments by investing through a wholly-owned subsidiary organized in the Cayman Islands (the “Subsidiary”). The Subsidiary invests solely in the Gold Investments and cash and cash equivalents.

fund_name: Defiance Daily Target 2X Long MSTR ETF
investment_objective: The Fund seeks daily investment results, before fees and expenses, of two times (200%) the daily percentage change in the share price of MicroStrategy Incorporated (Nasdaq: MSTR).
principal_strategies: The Fund is an actively managed exchange traded fund (ETF) that attempts to achieve two times (200%) the daily percentage change in the share price of MicroStrategy Incorporated by entering into swap agreements and, as needed, listed options contracts. At the end of each day, the Fund’s swaps are valued and the Fund’s investment adviser rebalances the Fund’s holdings in an attempt to maintain leveraged exposure equal to approximately 200% of the Underlying Security’s share price.

investment_objective: The Fund seeks daily investment results, before fees and expenses, of 2 times (200%) the daily percentage change of the common stock of NVIDIA Corporation.
principal_strategies: The Fund is an actively managed exchange traded fund that attempts to replicate 2 times (200%) the daily percentage change of the Underlying Stock by entering into financial instruments such as swaps and options on the Underlying Stock as well as directly purchasing the Underlying Stock. At the end of each trading day, the notional exposure against the Underlying Stock obtained through the combination of these instruments will be approximately 200% of the Fund’s net asset value.

investment_objective: The Fund seeks to track the investment results (before fees and expenses) of the PHLX Semiconductor Sector Index.
principal_strategies: The Fund generally invests at least 90% of its total assets in the securities comprising the PHLX Semiconductor Sector Index, employing a full replication methodology in proportion to their weightings.

fund_name: Defiance Daily Target 2X Short PLTR ETF
investment_objective: The Fund seeks daily inverse investment results, before fees and expenses, of -2 times (-200%) the daily percentage change in the share price of Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ: PLTR). The Fund does not seek to achieve its stated investment objective for a period other than a single trading day.
principal_strategies: The Fund is an actively managed exchange traded fund that attempts to achieve 2 times the inverse (-200%) of the daily percentage change in the price of the Underlying Security by employing derivatives, namely swap agreements and/or listed options contracts. The Fund aims to generate 2 times the inverse of the daily performance of the Underlying Security for a single day, and not for any other period. A single day is defined as being calculated from the close of regular trading on one trading day to the close on the next trading day. The Fund is classified as non-diversified under the 1940 Act.

fund_name: Innovator Uncapped Bitcoin 20 Floor ETF® — Quarterly
investment_objective: The Fund seeks to provide investors with investment results that participate in a percentage of any positive price returns of bitcoin (prior to taking into account management fees, shareholder transaction fees, brokerage commissions, taxes and any extraordinary expenses incurred by the Fund) while providing a maximum loss of 20% of any bitcoin price return losses (prior to taking into account management fees, shareholder transaction fees, brokerage commissions, taxes and any extraordinary expenses incurred by the Fund), over successive three-month periods.
principal_strategies: The Fund employs a defined outcome strategy by investing in FLEXible EXchange® Options that reference one or more exchange-traded products that hold bitcoin or the CBOE Bitcoin U.S. ETF Index, and in U.S. Treasury Bills, to seek participation in a percentage of bitcoin’s price gains while limiting losses to a defined floor over successive three-month Outcome Periods.

investment_objective: The Fund seeks daily investment results, before fees and expenses, of 300% of the inverse (or opposite) of the daily performance of the S&P 500 Index.
principal_strategies: Under normal circumstances, the Fund invests at least 80% of its net assets (plus borrowing for investment purposes) in swap agreements, futures contracts, or short positions that, in combination, provide 3X daily inverse exposure to the S&P 500 Index or ETFs that track the Index. The Fund may also gain inverse leveraged exposure by investing in a representative sample of the Index’s securities or shorting securities or ETFs that track the Index, and holds cash and cash equivalents as collateral.

investment_objective: The Fund seeks daily investment results, before fees and expenses, that correspond to three times the inverse (-3x) of the daily performance of the Nasdaq-100 Index.
principal_strategies: The Fund invests primarily in derivatives, including swap agreements and futures contracts, and money market instruments to achieve daily investment results corresponding to three times the inverse (-3x) of the daily performance of the Nasdaq-100 Index.

underlying_asset: ICE U.S. Treasury 20+ Year Bond Index
investment_objective: The Fund seeks to track the investment results of an index composed of U.S. Treasury bonds with remaining maturities greater than twenty years.
principal_strategies: The Fund seeks to track the ICE U.S. Treasury 20+ Year Bond Index using a representative sampling indexing strategy by investing at least 90% of its assets in the bonds of the Underlying Index and at least 95% in U.S. government bonds, may invest up to 10% in U.S. government bonds not included in the Index to improve tracking, and may invest up to 5% in repurchase agreements and cash equivalents.

investment_objective: The Fund seeks daily investment results, before fees and expenses, that correspond to three times (3x) the daily performance of the Nasdaq-100 Index.
principal_strategies: The Fund invests in financial instruments, including equity securities, swap agreements, futures contracts and money market instruments, that ProShare Advisors believes, in combination, should produce daily returns consistent with the Daily Target.

fund_name: Vanguard Health Care Index Fund ETF Shares
underlying_asset: MSCI US Investable Market Index (IMI)/Health Care 25/50
investment_objective: The Fund seeks to track the performance of a benchmark index that measures the investment return of health care stocks.
principal_strategies: The Fund employs an indexing investment approach designed to track the performance of the MSCI US Investable Market Index (IMI)/Health Care 25/50, an index made up of stocks of large, mid-size, and small U.S. companies within the health care sector, as classified under the Global Industry Classification Standard (GICS). The Fund attempts to replicate the target index by seeking to invest all, or substantially all, of its assets in the stocks that make up the Index, in order to hold each stock in approximately the same proportion as its weighting in the Index.

investment_objective: Vanguard 500 Index Fund seeks to track the performance of a benchmark index that measures the investment return of large-capitalization stocks.
principal_strategies: The Fund employs a "passive management"—or indexing—investment approach designed to track the performance of the Standard & Poor's 500 Index, a widely recognized benchmark of U.S. stock market performance that is dominated by the stocks of large U.S. companies. The Fund attempts to replicate the target index by investing all, or substantially all, of its assets in the stocks that make up the Index, holding each stock in approximately the same proportion as its weighting in the Index.

fund_name: The Energy Select Sector SPDR Fund
investment_objective: The Energy Select Sector SPDR Fund seeks to provide investment results that, before expenses, correspond generally to the price and yield performance of publicly traded equity securities of companies in the Energy Select Sector Index.
principal_strategies: In seeking to track the performance of the Index, the Fund employs a replication strategy, which means that the Fund typically invests in substantially all of the securities represented in the Index in approximately the same proportions as the Index. Under normal market conditions, the Fund generally invests substantially all, but at least 95%, of its total assets in the securities comprising the Index. The Fund may also invest in cash and cash equivalents or money market instruments, such as repurchase agreements and money market funds.

fund_name: Innovator Equity Defined Protection ETF™ — 1 Yr July
investment_objective: The Fund seeks to provide investors with returns that match the upside price return of the SPDR® S&P 500® ETF Trust, up to the upside cap of 7.00% (prior to taking into account management fees and other fees) while providing a buffer against 100% of SPDR® S&P 500® ETF Trust losses (prior to taking into account management fees and other fees), over the period from July 1, 2025 through June 30, 2026.
principal_strategies: The Fund invests in FLEXible EXchange® Options on the SPDR® S&P 500® ETF Trust to seek predetermined outcomes—a buffer against 100% of underlying ETF losses and a cap on upside returns—measured over an approximately one-year Outcome Period. It achieves these outcomes by purchasing put FLEX Options and selling call FLEX Options with strike prices and expirations aligned with the Outcome Period, and actively manages these positions to reset the buffer and cap at each period’s commencement.
